body:
Only some tags are allowed. In post bodies/comments, I think it's [these](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/master/ruqqus/helpers/sanitize.py). In titles, I think it's [these](https://bleach.readthedocs.io/en/latest/clean.html#bleach.clean). (Idk I just saw [this](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/b672714d9cbf96e12574053646343ba2ef0f46d0/ruqqus/routes/posts.py#L277) and looked it up)

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

body:
> I think it's [these](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/blob/master/ruqqus/helpers/sanitize.py). In titles, I think it's [these](https://bleach.readthedocs.io/en/latest/clean.html#bleach.clean).

Actually I think they're the same. The bleach page doesn't list the allowed tags, it just tells you how to set them up. I think `sanitize.py` configures the Cleaner globally, which is not uncommon in python.

This explains the `<sup>` thing though. I'm surprised you didn't figure this out earlier knowing about that.
body_html:
I think it's these. In titles, I think it's these.

Actually I think they're the same. The bleach page doesn't list the allowed tags, it just tells you how to set them up. I think sanitize.py configures the Cleaner globally, which is not uncommon in python.

This explains the <sup> thing though. I'm surprised you didn't figure this out earlier knowing about that.

body: Huh. [The title allows](https://ruqqus.com/+test/post/5xvv/acronym-titleendless-summer-is-my-favorite) `<acronym>`, which doesn't show up in sanitize.py.
